caption: The pasta I ordered took over 2 hours to be delivered and was ice cold. I had to throw it away.

I celebrated my birthday yesterday in this excellent restaurant. Well we enjoyed a wonderful evening and the place was clearly the reason for that strong evening. The team  helped in a gorgeous way, the cooking was extremely good and my buddies were so  joyful. We shall surely visit again for more joyful events. Thank you very much.
Great service and nice place to have wine with a friend.  The food is delicious; currently I love, love, love Pappardelle with short ribs ragout.
This spot is superb and roomy, the menu was enchanting and the rates were very reasonable. quick, efficient service and very welcoming staff. Will definitely recommend this restaurant.
The best!
The food is okay it's a hit or miss. I find it a little bit salty for my taste
Intellectual Italian. Quality off the charts. Bread  and salad superb. Nice service. Not box pasta. We are coming back!!°°
Good deals Monday and Tuesday nights.

Awesome hanger steak, great service.  Truly Italian cuisine, sister place is La Gioconda on 53rd.  When covid is over go to one of the best little italian places in Manhattan!  Come now to La Regional, Broadway and 99/98th.  UWS.
Great food excellent entertainment staff A plus

Regional has taken care of me with delicious orders through out the Pandemic. The pasta dishes are like my great grandmother made it and that's hard to beat! The deliveries are fast and the entrees are  always the BEST. Thank you for taking such good care of me. Lasagna Lady, Jan R

Ordered directly from the Restaurant for delivery.  Not using GrubHub anymore to better support these restaurants.  Had the veal meatballs with polenta,  broccoli rabe , asparagus gratinee and fried zucchini sticks... enough for 5 meals with generous sides.  Excellent food, arrived still hot and boy do I feel stupid for not frequenting this place 3 blocks from my apartment just cause I had a bad date there 10 years ago!

Great service, mediocre food, tired interior. The waitress was very attentive and service was quick. The food was ordinary. The lasagna was doughy; the gnocchi was bland. Good cheesecake dessert though. The interior is charmless, the walls need painting, and add some candles to the tables (even fake candles would be better than nothing.) The $100+ bill (not including tip) was high for this quality of food.
Solid option if you live nearby, but probably not worth traveling out of your way for.  Decent Italian food, but nothing standout, given the other options in the area.

The food (as long as you dine in) is FINE. But honestly, the incompetence for takeaway is out of control. We had to call and complain on TWO separate occasions. The first time they completely left the prosciutto off a $14 salad that is literally just prosciutto and melon. The second time, I specifically ordered a salad with grilled peaches and they sent me this wet, inedible mass of red cabbage with 3 sad slices of pear,  zero peaches, and no explanation. So inept. Never again. Go to Lucciola on Amsterdam.
Loved the service and the drinks

I went for a brunch and I got the avocado toast Benedict. Dissapointed and definetly I would not come back for the food. The bread was hard and was not really toasted. The egg was fully cooked, it should be soft in the center but it was more like a hard boiled egg. And last (look by yourself, pics below) the avocado was a very thin layer of an already blackened avocado. My guess is that they prepare the mixture early in the morning and when it got to my untoasted toast was a few hours later. I could have pass it if flavor was OK, or eggs were great or something was good... but nope, worst avocado toast of my entire life. Owners are kind, the rest of the service is poor.
Staff and atmosphere are great. I went against my judgement and got the veal special. It was very tough. Very tough. Not flavorful either. But their other foods are good.
Excellent 👍
Delicious all what we order , my birthday was successful I strongly recommend this restaurant
Service was bad. The old male server was very rude
Great food, wine, and desserts. I will be back! Thanks to Dario for the warm welcome!
Great brunch and great pasta. Lovely staff. Very accomadating with children.
11 years of coming here and still loving it!
(Translated by Google) Excellent! Dario da Very Good!  (Original) Excellent! Dario da Molto Bene!
(Translated by Google) Excellent Italian food and good service  (Original) Excelente comida italiana y buen servicio

So I work in this area decided to go on night with my husband like 3 months ago and been there every tue and Friday gray food wine and service is amazing Lucas the server is amazing as all the staff as well as the bartender on tue she great they great us as we part of there family great job all keep doing an amazing job......
Great food , great place , great owner ! :)
My go to brunch spot. Simply perfect!
(Translated by Google) rich  (Original) Rico
Totally delicious and has been for years.  We go a couple of times a month and I've never been disappointed.  Everything is good, but the pastas are exceptional.
Inventive regional Italian dishes with wines to match. Friendly and casual.
Worst pasta I've had at a place that bills itself as authentic Italian. Carbonara was a runny soup and service inattentive to boot.
Bad service..  bad brunch.. the brunch manager was stressed

I don't even live on the UWS, but $10 bottomless mimosas along with seriously good brunch food. I'm sold now.  I had the artisanal sausages - buffalo & chipotle chili and rabbit & white wine sausages, with over easy eggs and country potatoes. Both had such clear, distinct flavor profiles - I really can't complain. Delicious!

Ordered food via Seamless.  - Prosciutto salad came without the prosciutto - tried to call 5 times and didn’t pick up the phone - when I asked Seamless to refund the salad, the restaurant called to complain to ME when Seamless accidentally refunded the entire order - didn’t even apologize for terrible customer experience - food was meh, Spagetti were overcooked  Won’t order again, sad given that I live just next door
Clearly just wants to be a bar not a quality Italian place in NYC. 3 PM still only serving brunch. I have had better spaghetti at a diner, waiters could not have cared less about our requests.
Awesome food. Great neighborhood place.
Very good
everything was kind of meh
Got the lasagna to go. Pasta was so over cooked it was like soup. The filling felt, tasted, and looked like thick buttery chef Boyardee. Bummer after paying $18 bucks for it.
Nice spot.   Good specials.   Definitely a small owner business genuine NYC Italian feel. Great food.
Excellent food and ambiance.
The service was attentive and friendly. The atmosphere was cozy and comfortable. We, my family and I, had 3 different dishes and each was delicious. Yeah, I had my fork in all three plates.
Great Italian food
Small Italien resturant with okay prices.
The food was great.
Superb brunch
(Translated by Google) It eats well in a good relation cost x benefit  (Original) Come-se bem numa boa relação custo x benefício
Great owners who take care of patrons! Unlimited drinks on Sundays! Gotta love Italians!!!👍🏻👍🏻

The food is great. It's one of the best Italian restaurants in the city of New York.  Just try and you will come back again.  I love everything about the cooking. They  have great chiefs who  are  doing a  wonderful job.. I went to so many different  restaurant  but this one is number one.  Do not hesitate to make  a stop keep up the good work!

Fun atmosphere. Yummy food. Staff is great. This is my niece's favorite brunch spot. She's been going here since she was 6 months old. She's 8, going on 40, now. (It's made her a good conversationalist-albeit it's usually about her (it's an age thing, I'm sure)). She thinks of Jody, one of the owners as her aunt. There's always crayons, good food and good conversation to be had at your own table, other's tables, the waiters and the owners.
My folks come here almost every Monday for the good food. Great ambience and well priced, even other days of the week!

Better than most, but served sweet, too sweet, muffins instead of bread.  Desert is for after the meal, guys. Fries are restaurant supply frozen reheated. Coild be better. Steak and eggs, the over easy eggs were cooked perfectly. Just runny enough, and no indigestible burnt bits at the edges. Steak was cooked just as ordered. Medium rare, not bloody or overcooked leather.  Salad all fresh, no wilted leaves.  There's more on the menu
I ordered the pappardelle pasta with beef. The pasta was overcooked. The waitress wouldn't stop asking us what we wanted to drink and order when we just literally sat down.

I love this place. My good friends took my to the owners previous restaurant in 2016, where they were regulars, and since that sadly closed I’ve been fortunate to eat at Regional on several occasions. The food is great, especially their brunch (and especially with cocktails), and the staff are amazingly warm people. You will feel like a local even if you’re from several of thousands of miles away like me (UK). Can’t wait to revisit New York and Regional.
Good prices, great food, great atmosphere!
Good food. Lackluster service.
Last week I ordered my food and it took 3 hours to come. It is only 8 blocks away from my apartment. I enjoyed eating at the restaurant, don't waste your time getting it delivered.
I like coming here on Monday nights for $10 pasta and a glass of wine. The food is good and the place is comfortable, however, the service is consistently awful.
Excellent quality-price ratio. A bit on the noisy side.
Good brunch special, the drinks keep flowing.
Good food and service

I'm writing this to recommend one of the best Italian restaurants I have visited in New York City. I consider myself a bit of an expert on authentic Italian food and a self-proclaimed foodie with high expectations when it comes to restaurants boasting authentic Italian. I am here to say that Regional Restaurant and Wine Bar in the Upper West Side of Manhattan is by far the best Italian food I have had since I left Italy. Every meal is prepared with the utmost authenticity and perfection. The service is impeccable and the atmosphere is just as if you were in Italy, with the owner visiting each table and personally ensuring that you are receiving the best service and meal possible. The chef is nothing short of an artist and his pairings of flavors and marriage of items in the daily specials are simply masterful. select any salad or pasta dish and you are sure to not only be pleased but have your expectations exceeded. The Branzino with couscous and clams flavored with lemon Capers and wine and served with the bed of fried leeks as light as air is one of the best dishes I have ever had in my life. Every item on the menu is perfect. The prefix menu at a low price of $25 offers you an appetizer generous entree and dessert all prepared with the greatest authenticity of true Italian cooking. They offer a great selection of Wines and Liquors and the owner is quick to recommend the perfect pairing for your meal. Weather permitting outdoor dining is also available to give you that Al Fresco Italian feel. Regional Restaurant and Wine Bar on Broadway and 98th may not get the notoriety of other Italian restaurants in the area but I have tried them all and I am here to tell you that this one is the only one that I have found that exceeds my expectations each and every time. I have been there 3 times in the last week and have been delighted on each visit. consistency, continuity and reliability are important to me and I know that I will always get a perfect meal at Regional. All of the desserts are fantastic but the real Hidden Gem is the hand-made semifreddo and I guarantee you will not find this anywhere else! They offer a fantastic deal on weekend brunch and overall the prices are on par if not less than many of the competition. I will also say that the portions are generous and you always get the best bang for your buck. If you haven't visited this restaurant and you like Italian food that is not only authentic but served in an authentic Italian atmosphere, then I encourage you to visit Regional Restaurant and Wine Bar in the Upper West Side. This is one of the Hidden gems of uws Manhattan.
Great food, slow service. $10 pasta on Mondays!

Their Wednesday wine deal is really amazing. The food was fantastic, the vibe is contemporary. The service was fantastic. Great date place, and definitely will be my go-to after a long day at work. I wish they would expand their hours though
Dope brunch. Truly bottomless
The pasta was "Al Dente" and very delicious
Wonderful !
A bit off beaten track and looks very modest but food was really good, and features local Italian specialties
Good fresh pasta
Delicious Italian food. The specials are always excellent. Service is good and drinks are well made. Best local Italian on the UWS.

I've been here a few times. Each time for brunch and each time with different people. The food is very, very good. You won't need to worry about that. They also offer these muffins that are complimentary for the first batch. You'll want more. Delicious!  The service is above average, but I get the feeling that they get overwhelmed easily, so you may need to flag your waiter down once or twice, and the food may take a few minutes longer than you'd hope.  All in all though, this is a HIGHLY recommended place.  Oh, and the lady who I think is the manager there is a character. Very take it or leave it!
Very respectable place. Will visit again.
Nice neighborhood Italian restaurant. Great food, friendly staff.
Good Food
Sevice was great. The food was just ok
Excellent food, excellent service
Food is pasta centered no classic (manicotti/lasagna nor veal) Excellent herbed lamb chops, generous portion... Good service
Expensive, but a really nice place with great Italian food. 'american standard' amounts of cheese on a platter. Would recommend
(Translated by Google) The delivery arrives fast and the food is very good  (Original) Los delivery llegan rápido y la comida muy buena
It makes me sad to leave a 1 star review for a restaurant, but overall it was just such a poor experience. Go anywhere else.
Best bottomless brunch in town! Our waitress (I think she was the owner) was fantastic and hilarious. We will be back
Great Monday and Tuesday specials

This is my favorite brunch spot when I'm in the city. The food is great, service is awesome and unlimited mimosas brunch special will have you coming back for more. Be sure to give the blueberry vodka lemonade a try also. You will not be disappeared.
Amazing unlimited mimosa deal (only $7). Food is nothing to write home about, but no complaints. If you are looking for a boozey brunch check out this spot.
Had a very nice brunch here. Good Bloody Mary's.
Great time with the family.
Excellent service, really enjoyed the food and the drinks. Will definitely be coming back on another Tuesday to take advantage of the 3 course meal for 25. Real traditional Italian food.
I like regional
A good place for Brunch!

Nice neighborhood Italian that's moderately high end.  Go Monday for $10 any pasta or Wednesday for half priced wine.  They have a lemon butter shrimp over angel hair that brought new meaning to the dish for me.
Their parmesan fries are to die for
I went on a Tuesday night when you can get a salad, entree, and dessert for $25.  It was a great value and all of the food was great.  There chocolate souffle for dessert was heavenly!

Fantastic brunch! Had the duck and rabbit sausages, quite possibly the best sausage I've ever had. Very reasonably priced bottomless brunch ($10 bloodies and mimosas, $12 sangria). Friendly staff and nice atmosphere. Will be back for sure.
🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥 Brunch 🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥 my glass was never empty. Food was on point.
(Translated by Google) They made me feel at Italy!  (Original) Mi hanno fatto sentire a Italia!
Came here for brunch. Would recommend the carbonara benedict. They aren't kidding about the mimosa refills, kept our glasses full the whole time. Lovely staff, good food.

Poor customer service and bland ravioli. I asked the waiter which he would recommend out of the two pastas and he replied, "Why are you asking me? I don't know. I don't know what you want to eat!". This was extremely rude and as the HEAD waiter I would have expected better service. Giving a recommendation is not that hard and as a waiter, it is actually part of your job to know what you are serving to your customers.  The pasta I ordered was bland and was an entree size with only 3 pieces of ravioli. Extremely disappointing.
Pretty good neighborhood place with specials on some weeknights.

(Translated by Google) Nice little restaurant in the UWS. The $ 10 pasta on Monday made it our weekly meeting, not extraordinary but honorable at this price!  (Original) Petit restau sympa dan l'UWS. Les pâtes à 10$ le lundi en ont fait notre rdv hebdomadaire, pas extraordinaire mais honorable à ce prix !
Nice and cozy place with great food!
Nice food and place. Good for a dinner in a calm evening

I visited November 2016 with a bunch of university students from Australia and we loved the cheap Monday meals! The lasagna, ravioli and lava cakes were amazing, great price for the quality and would definitely go back next time I'm in NY.
Friendly, tasty and clean 💯✔

(Translated by Google) An Italian restaurant without pizza or risotto does not have a real Italian restaurant. I am very disappointed with the menu that this restaurant offers.  (Original) Un restaurant italien sans pizza ou risotto n ai pas un vrai restaurant italien. Je suis très déçu de la carte que ce restaurant propose.
Food is mediocre and prices are going up. Might as well try another spot in the neighborhood.
Fair Italian restaurant

Everything was pretty good except for one of the waiters/hosts who just screamed so loud the whole night at staff and customers walking in. Older women who seeemed to get reall worked up/ stressed out. . One guy got up form the bar to use the bathroom and she yelled at him "sir I'll be right with you". He was just going to the bathroom. Other waitstaff seems super chill and amazing bartender. Food was pretty good, wine mid range. Nice atmosphere if not for the tense lady.
Wonderful neighborhood establishment. Good for kids in the early evening,  nice little bar scene in the evenings, boozy brunch on Saturday and Sunday. Friendly owners. Great pastas.
Order was incorrect, sausages and eggs seemed undercooked. Food was not bad in general, but not great. Service was slow, but bottomless mimosas and Bloody Mary's were awesome.
One of few nice restaurants nearby, very good food. It's clean and has a nice bar and atmosphere. Recommended.
Finally a good brunch spot in the upper west side. Good prices, bottomless mimosas and good food!

We went here to celebrate mother's day with brunch. I understand that it was a busy day, but if that's the case, they needed more servers. Service was spotty when we arrived and the place was almost empty at that point. As more parties arrived the service became crazy. We had to wait over 45 minutes for our food and when it arrived some dishes were some cold, others not even cooked through. Whilst eating we had a plate cleared (by the manager) from in front of one of us whilst in the middle of eating. It was then very difficult to get anyone's attention to ask for this to be corrected. We were then asked to hurry up as the were other bookings that need to be seated. We were pushed out within 15 minutes of receiving our food. Busy occasion or not, the service was terrible and points to poor management. The food was also sub-par. I won't be returning and would not recommend.
Very good and not too expensive
Omg Artisinal sausages, spice your own Bloody Mary... quite clever! AND BOTTOMLESS BOOZY BRUNCH!
I have come here many times and the experience has always been amazing.  I especially enjoy their brunches, and the prosciutto pizza is a must to try.
So delicious

Friendly manager who always remembers me and my friends.  We go there for brunch most Sundays.  The unlimited mimosas are a bit pale but the staff comes by constantly for refills.  We enjoy the artisanal breakfast sausages and other breakfast foods.  Only complaint: one friend (and only one friend) complains that they always get his order wrong.  I didn't believe him at first, but it has now happened to him in my presence three times in a row.
The food is fantastic and the service is great!
Absolutely delicious italian food. Some of the best pasta I have ever had. And not as pricy as the atmosphere may suggest.
Good food, friendly service. As the name implies, it is regional cuisine; for spaghetti marinara and meatballs you need to go elsewhere
Jet lagged family needed some comfort food and found it here
Always great food and excellent service...love this place for both brunch and dinner........mondays all their pastas are 9 follars....does not get any better then that...
Menu is limited and strange (lots of disparate things, kind of lacking breakfast items for a brunch menu). But! The owner is super cool, and the bottomless mimosas deal can't be beat!

The three of us had a really warm and attentive waiter, in addition to the two other people who kept our table cleared and asked if there was anything we needed throughout the meal.  One of our party has a gluten allergy, so the waiter made sure none of the ingredients in his meal would spoil the night.  The food was well-seasoned and cooked just right.  The Pasta Seafood special offered a large lobster.  To sum up, I worked really hard for my salary. So, when I go out for dinner, I won't accept an O.K. meal.  And Regional impressed all of us last night.

I am not a vegan but I will only eat Sweet & Sara marshmallows because they are so so so delicious. I make special trips to the city to pick them up myself and the owner meets me at the office herself to hand deliver them!! When I stopped in over the summer to pick up a massive bag of the ever delicious toasted coconut marshmallows, she  was even polite enough to offer some water because it was swelteringly hot out. These marshmallows pair great with Lagusta's Luscious vegan chocolates.
Great brunch and service

This is the only one in the city I’ve been to and I think it was the greatest introduction to the chain as it is the newest, cleanest, and biggest (seats about 12-15). The menu on the wall is gigantic, so those of you who are indecisive

Hands down the best bottom-less brunch deal in the city!! If you want a reasonably priced, and delicious, boozy brunch, look no farther. You have to make a commitment to either Bloody Marys or Mimosas -- but they are verrrry generous and diligent with the refills ;)  They have a range of artisinal sausages which stood out for me -- and I am HUGE fan of the Pomodorro.
Great brunch place! Their artesanal sausages are great, and their unlimited mimosas/bloody marys are continuously flowing, even when the place is packed!

Weekend brunch is fantastic if you get there early.  Bottomless BLOODY MARY and wide selection of jerkys.  The food is good, but nothing extraordinary.  The staff is always friendly and it's a nice place to spend your weekend morning.
Great staff, one of the most generous brunches in the city, top notch plates! This is a winner! RSVP in advance to make everyone's life easier!
Amazing!!! Brunch was great... will try Dinner soon!!
We enjoyed our dinner, great pastas and the lamb chops are great! We will be back for more

I was visiting a friend on the UWS, we ended up going to eat at Regional and we were very impressed. It had great service; nice waiters and the food came out quickly. The food was amazing! We ate the grilled octopus, I think it was the special, and a cacio e pepe which is like an Italian variant of mac' and cheese. It was so creamy and cheesy, yum! We will definitely go back for more!

My dinner started with a Pepsi from a poorly calibrated gun, making it bitter. The mozzarella, tomato, and basil was actually a mixed green salad with mozzarella and tomato on the side. The mozzarella was watery and under seasoned. The greens were over salted and under dressed. My steak, ordered medium, was served black and blue with an over salted arugula. In spite of the fact that the waiter who took my order left midway through our meal -- I guess guess his shift ended -- the service was very good. Apologetic and attentive. Unfortunately, good service doesn't make up for sub par food with so many other great options within mere blocks.

Have been here a few times for dinner and once for brunch (which was great). This is a great place with good food. Monday night they have $9 Pasta night, which is a real hit. However, this place has MAJOR problems with their workflow and this results is really bad service (though the waitresses are really nice and helpful). It looked like to me that there was a lack of staff, and the ones that were there were not tasks correctly. There was about 12 people waiting to be seated, with many many open tables insides. For some reason, the hostess, was also the busboy, cleaning and setting the tables, resulting in the long wait for dinner. My advice, get a better manager to create a better workflow plan for staff.
Nice Place And Good food. A bit expensive

In many cases, the term 'neighborhood spot' is a positive one. In this case, it means that the place is run down, completely dead on a Friday night, and no longer serving some of the beers/items on its outdated menu. Avoid.

Though the venue is nice, and the mimosa refills were frequent and generous, the quality of everything was sub par. Our mimosas were warm, and the food itself wasn't good. My friends Egg's Benedict was over cooked, and the sausages I ordered I thought were pretty lousy. They were unique sausages that I suppose are relatively hard to come by, but they just didn't taste very good at the end of the day. We also ordered a burger with fries, and instead of fries, we got lettuce with NO dressing. So if we theoretically ordered salad, it still would have been a messed up order. Then when we got the fries, they were cold and tasted like sand.  Overall, it's hard to recommend this place.
The waitress had a mean attitude and right as he served us she litteraly threw the plates. As she walked away she scratched her head to grab another plate to serve.... made me wonder.
Terrible food!  We ordered two different salads with added chicken. The chicken was flavorless and dry. The beets tasted canned. Save yourself from this place!
Great food and service. I love their free mini muffins! Crumb skin and moist cake inside. So delicious! Pizza is crispy and nice too. Tiramisu is average.

Food was okay but the service was pretty terrible. We were greeted in a friendly manner, but it went downhill from there. The waiter made it very difficult to get suggestions, he struggled to answer questions about menu items and drinks, and before we even finished eating, they were stacking chairs 45 minutes before they were scheduled to close. 30 minutes prior, they dim the lights for a second trying to push us out, as the waiter sits at a table with his phone. Unprofessional and inhospitable. Despite decent food, I don't plan on returning. Shame.

Ok, so I've eaten here a few times and even if the  waiters I've encountered are rude, the manager and other staff have been super friendly and the food has always been awesome. Today, however, is a different story. First the manager chastised us for being on our phones instead of eating.. which I shrugged off as her being a saucy NY'er. Then my sister's eggs (which she ordered over medium) were overcooked on one side and RAW on the other side. When the manager came over to see what was wrong, my sister let her know that the eggs were not cooked properly and it was just to let her know so she could tell the kitchen staff. At first the manager sort of apologized and asked if my sister wanted a replacement, to which my sis calmly turned down. The manager, however, got super rude again and told my sister that "from now on when people come in and order eggs, that I'm going to tell them not to be so particular and specific about how they want them cooked" My sister mentioned that, if they offer eggs cooked in different styles, they should be able to make them the way they're ordered. Then the  manager walked away and came back and wouldn't leave my sister alone. Then when i tried to calm the situation down, the manager came over to me and with a nasty attitude said "oh its ok don't worry about it my mother is the same way". She ruined my sisters birthday brunch and acted as if we the customers were asking for too much, she wouldnt drop it or apologize appropriately. NONE of us are ever coming here again and all of my friends neither.
This is our normal Sunday brunch spot, the service is always fantastic and the food is always great!

What can I say? There's nothing better than the $9 pasta on Mondays. It's a great way to begin your week. We love the service and atmosphere. We highly recommend the mozzarella/basil/tomato salad for appetizer and any pasta dish with veal in it. Tiramisu is always a killer dessert here. We just wish we liked their wine selections better. On weekends, the brunch is a real treat, especially the $7 mimosas and the nap afterwards.
Staple brunch spot

I came here for Brunch on a Saturday and was completely wowed by the customer service here. The waitress was so incredibly attentive and friendly. I ordered their unlimited mimosa and I never had to ask for a refill ever. Every time I looked at my cup it was always full. Even the manager checked in a couple of times and made me feel like a regular. I also got one of their breakfast pizza, which had the perfect sunny side up eggs. I can't wait to go back. Make sure you get there before noon for brunch, it got super crowded by the time I left around 2pm and a line was starting to form.
Good bottomless drink brunch place. It does get a little packed so service can be slow sometimes, but it's good food and drinks and inexpensive. The mini muffins they serve are delicious!
I've only ever come here for weekend brunches and have always had a good time. Generous mimosa refills and standard fare brunch meals.
Some unusual pasta dishes that are very good. Friendly service.

The $9 pasta nights on Mondays and the $25 three-course prix fixe on Tuesdays are real bargains. Try to sit away from the bar if you want to carry on a conversation. Service can be spotty. The weekend brunch is a good deal as well.

Gave up eating in the restaurant itself on account of pathetic service. After a while, decided to start ordering delivery. The food is reasonably good -- not amazing, but better than average -- so this seemed like a bulletproof way to avoid poor service... whoops.  Once, an actual waiter appeared at my door with my order. This struck me as unusual, but not inherently wrong. I live only a block away. Later, a delivery guy couldn't figure out how to open the door when buzzed in. Again, strange, not necessarily wrong... just strange. Then, last week, on a Friday night, after waiting over an hour for an order, I called over and was told my order had just left. Fifteen minutes later (again, I live only a block away) I decided to put on my shoes and a jacket and just walk over to the restaurant.  The restaurant was half-full. The bartender seemed also to be doubling as the manager -- and he was completely overwhelmed. The staff seemed to recognize this and was going out of its way to present all sorts of problems to him and make the situation worse. At one point a waiter actually handed him with a plate of food that the had been incorrectly prepared and made him bring it back to the kitchen despite his dealing with any number of other things at the moment, including me. Again, the place wasn't even half-full. It was clearly a punitive act. I can't say whether it was deserved, but it was obnoxious and childish and remarkably unprofessional.  My order then appeared out of the kitchen. One one hand, I was pleased -- at least the food would be hot -- but on the other hand, of course, I realized that this was probably the last straw for me. The bartender/manager acknowledged that I had actually come to pick up a delivery order, he was clearly the person who I had spoken to on the phone, who had clearly lied to me about my order, and he acknowledged none of this. I then waited five minutes for him to find a bag to put my food in.  I hope the chef fires the front of the house and opens another restaurant. The food is good. The service, however, is so poor as to be comical, if it weren't so offensively -- and I'm willing to say deliberately -- awful.

Nice with a place serving Italian food where the pasta sauces aren't overly creamy. All in all a place for totally decent Italian fare, but nothing out of the ordinary. Great value of pasta dishes on Monday nights though. The low noise level was appreciated.
Come here for brunch. Push them for the basket of muffins - they should bring them out for you! Paninis here are a great brunch selection.

One dimensional.  It offers great value for brunch but the rest of the time it is overpriced with small portions without the flavor you would expect from a place this pricey.  Plenty of others spots with better value elsewhere in the neighborhood.

This is one of my go-to places on the Upper West Side for brunch, and recently tried it for dinner with my boyfriend. The wine list is fantastic & the food is delicious! I had the braised lamb shank which was a bit salty, but still delicious! Highly recommended for a quiet but delicious date dinner.

the name refers to the different areas of italy and offers a truly varied sampling of the different italian food regions.  the food is always excellent.  the decor is a little spare but it doesn't detract from the good food and friendly service.
